Hej. Kan ingen beskriva alt. Slänga upp url till någon bra guide för hur man installerar? Fattar nada...

Har en HTC desire, tack på förhand.

1. mount your SDcard to your Pc
2. Move the folder "Navigon" to the Root of your SDcard
3. Copy the Navigon 2.6.1.apk file on your SDcard
4. Copy The map files to your Sd card in the /Navigon/map/ , you don't have to copy every map
5. unmount your SDcard. Open the Navigon 2.6.1.apk on your phone whit a filemanager and install the application
6. Enjoy!

Works great on HTC Desire HD (Android) hereâ€™s how: On your phone go to market and download
The app called â€œeFile-File Managerâ€ and install it. Plug your phone in via USB to your PC. When it asks you to choose a connection type, tap on Disk drive and tap done. A menu should pop up asking you how you want to view the Drive. Click on â€œopen  folder to view filesâ€. Now double click on downloads. Now on your PC go to where you have the downloaded navigon files. copy the Navigon folder and Navigon V2.6.1 apk and the Denmark.map which is in the folder Map 2010 Q1 to the downloads folder on your phone. When itâ€™s done coping you can close the drive were you see all the stuff from your phone.  Leave your phone pugged in if itâ€™s not fully charged. Now go on your phone and open eFile-File manager and and you will see (blue little icons) Root  SDCard  Gallery   etc. Tap SDCard once with your finger to open it. Scroll down to downloads. Here you have to double tap the downloads icon fast. Now tap on the icon Navigon V2.6.1 apk and it will install. When itâ€™s done it will ask you if you want to install maps. â€œYESâ€ they are the latest! I did it via WLAN and it works great! You will have to wait 10 minutes but itâ€™s worth the wait. The Navigon icon will be automatically in your menu on your phone. Just look for it. Enjoy!!!!

I do as the readme-file tells me:
- I copy the NAVIGON folder to the root of the SDCARD
- I copy the maps that i want into NAVIGON/MAPS.
- I copy the Navigon v2.6.1 to the navigon folder since the readme file does not specify where one should place this file.

Then i disconnect my phone by ejecting it from win. I use a file manager (ES File explorer) and start the Navigon v2.6.1 file. It seems to be installing normally. But when i try to start it from the app folder, i get an error message "The application Navigon (Process com.navigation.navigator) gets closed unexpected. Try it again" (or something like that :P, i translated it from norwegian).

My phone: HTC Desire HD
Android 2.2.3
Core version: 2.6.35.10-g0956377
Build no: 2.36.405.8 CL47853
Software no: 2.36.405.8
